cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight then turning north on Wednesday and north-northeast on Thursday, paralleling the Georgia coast and passing very near or over the South Carolina coast before accelerating northeastward offshore of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the central South Carolina coast (close approach to the Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Savannah River SC to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida’s Treasure Coast through Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (56% cumulative) of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds and up to hurricane-force gusts as the eye passes nearby Thursday; 34-kt winds almost certain (91%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge forecast calls for 4–7 ft inundation from the Savannah River to Cape Lookout, which includes Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible along the South Carolina coast with locally higher amounts, creating flash-flood potential around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, large battering waves and life-threatening rip currents; brief tornado threat in rainbands.
